greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Maximum length of a divisibility chain of consecutive divisors of n.
example: The divisors of 968 split into consecutive divisibility chains {{1, 2, 4, 8}, {11, 22, 44, 88}, {121, 242, 484, 968}}, so a(968) = 4.
xref: Taking only proper divisors gives A328194.
The maximum run-length among divisors of n is A055874.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Oct 06 2019
